docs.text: an energetic , visually stunning , but intellectually hollow recreation of the mysterious life of jeanne d'arc .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in history jeanne d'arc is lost in an ocean of mystery and controversy , which creates the perfect launching pad for talented and creative directors , who can basically alter the story as they wish .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she came in a time where people desperately needed a saint .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a hero that could rescue them for misery and deliver peace and happiness .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: director/writer luc besson ( 'nikita' , 'leon' ) portrays his version of the peasant girl who commanded the armies of france and was burned at the stake for witchcraft .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: besson tries to recreate the person behind the legend .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he tries not to show her as a saint or a villain .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he shows her as a human being .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in a time where blood was almost pouring from the sky , and the air smelled of rotten flesh , it is hard to keep your sanity .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the only support and hope is in god .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at the age of 13 , jeanne ( milla jovovich ) watches her own sister murdered and raped by the english soldiers .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this terrible event makes a lasting impact on jeanne's mind .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: god is no longer her support .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he has become her obsession .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she starts seeing visions and signs that command her to raise an army and free france from the siege of the english tyranny .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: with the help of the wise yolande d'aragon ( faye dunaway ) and charles vii ( john malcovich ) , whose grand royal ambitions and life are at stake , jeanne raises an army and marches towards the english walls .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after this the film stays mostly on the battlefield , where besson demonstrates his ability to direct amazing action sequences , only occasionally resorting to a calmer tempo .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the movie is filled with dreamy , symbolic images of pure artistic craftsmanship , that create a surreal and occasionally paranoiac atmosphere .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film is lost in time and space , hysterically jumping back and forth in jeanne's thoughts , imagination and conscience .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: besson's visual style permits the audience to enter the medieval age , feel the smell of fresh blood and the adrenaline pumping in your body in the heat of battle .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but the film is far from being flawless .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the script needs a lot of polishing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: except for jeanne , there are no real characters .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and although a grand star cast is assembled , their characters are nothing more than props , not more alive than the costumes that they are wearing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as for the maiden of lorraine herself , she is portrayed as a simple girl , too small for her divine task .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in the latter part of the film , we see her as hysterical , confused and on the brink of madness , with her past purity and innocence for ever lost .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: jovovich handles the part with more panache than one might expect .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but though her screen time is incredible excessive , both malcovich ( 'being john malcovich' ) and dunaway ( 'titus' ) surpass her rather overacted and simply unprofessional performance .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and even hoffman manages to breathe some life into his dreadfully small part .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: besides casting jovovich , besson's only mistake is his extreme sense of patriotism that in the end ruins his so gloriously crafted painting .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are some viscously evil englishmen that murder , pillage and betray with a smile on their faces .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and some incredibly brave and noble frenchmen , represented by the " three musketeers " of this story -- the brave gilles de rais ( vincent cassel ) , the wise aulon ( desmond harrington ) and the strong la hire ( richard ridings ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: though all those actor perform well , their characters are nothing more than symbols -- banners that proclaim the glory of france .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and thus , there is no sense of realism in this film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: 'the messenger' has muscles instead of brains .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is some relief in the end , where besson lays down his armor and starts thinking .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: dustin hoffman's appearance helps and the film ends elegantly and surprisingly effective with a climax worthy of praise .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: jeanne's character is unlocked , but whether god was in the picture or not , is never quite explained .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: was she a confused peasant girl driven by her own hunger for revenge ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: or was she truly a messenger of god ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film poses as many questions as answers and nothing is completely obvious .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: bess o messenger' is nothing more than a fairly good film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is not much that you remember of it after you leave the theater .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: maybe the sound , the dreamy sequences , but certainly not the dialogue .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is an elegant and adrenaline pumping history lesson for the mtv-generation , that although presents some interesting material , works better when it's on the battlefield .
docs.label: positive
